Entries.default: "Shortage? Are the Roparu not fed the leavings of the Kuaru and Mataru?"
"The Gullet is in a poor state. There's little enough to go around."
"You're killing those people, the least you could do is pay attention."
"Again you bring this up. Speak on, I say." Prince Aruihi sighs and opens his palm.
"The Dawnstars have agreed to offer a share of their crops to Neketaka, as long as the bulk of it goes to the Roparu."
"The Roparu need their queen. Won't she step in?"
"The tribes beyond our city look to her as well, and their problems are as numerous as fish in the sea."
Sighing, Prince Aruihi presses his palms together and nods.
"I hear rumor of pirates in the Gullet... ekera, they say my people shelter them in exchange for meager sustenance."
"It is no wonder how Delver's Row won the love of my people, I say... by feeding them when we could not."
As his eyes narrow, Prince Aruihi slowly begins to take deep breaths through his nose.
"You overreach, captain. This is a dangerous thing to do in Neketaka, much less the halls of the Kahanga."
"It would be a shame if the trading companies recognized this failure of leadership."
"Ekera, for what would she sit on her hands if she had the time? Or the resources?" Aruihi pierces you with an annoyed look.
"Back to my other questions."

"But I... am of a different mind. Nothing pleases Ngati like an unlikely solution, and this is what you bring. 

"Ekera, then let it be so." 

He nods, a smile parting his lips.
"My sister would call this a test from the gods. It is our role to feed the Roparu, and we do not pass on our duties to outsiders." Aruihi thumbs his chin, nodding.
"Ekera, if one framed it that way." The prince squeezes his hands into fists.

"I will dredge up the resources to feed the Roparu if the meat must come from my own body. 

"The work of keeping pace with our rivals... there is no end, I say." Aruihi sighs and shakes his head.
"They need more, my prince."
"Find us solutions instead of old problems, I say."
